channel.title: Client.java Problem please read
channel.description:
This is my entire client.java.... I was in the process of adding "Loyalty Titles" to my RSPS and then I got errors next time i tried to compile... Here is a photo/document of the errors I had received: www.pastebin.com/xHvude6u And here is a my entire client.java www.pastebin.com/asscSZ5Q
Please let me know what went wrong, and what I can do to fix it... Id like the loyalty titles to be working... Thanks a ton.. Sincerely, Trade Me

item.title: Client.java Problem please read
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:4, topic:448302”]No I realized that’s not the problem, a for loop like that compiles perfectly fine. But it’s extremely hard to deduce the problem with the horrendous bracing in that class. But I do know one thing

if(player.combatLevel > myPlayer.combatLevel) c = '\u07D0'; if(myPlayer.team != 0 && player.team != 0) if(myPlayer.team == player.team) c = '\u07D0'; else c = '\0';

Could be done with a ternary chopping the code down to two lines i.e

if(myPlayer.team !=0 && player.team !=0) myPlayer.team == player.team ? '\u07D0'; : '\0';
http://java.about.com/od/t/g/ternaryoperator.htm[/quote]

Thank you, But that isn’t the problem…
I really need to learn some more client sided stuff…I’m only source sided…
So BUMP, I still want this solved by anyone or any means…

Read full topic

item.title: Client.java Problem please read
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

No I realized that’s not the problem, a for loop like that compiles perfectly fine. But it’s extremely hard to deduce the problem with the horrendous bracing in that class. But I do know one thing

if(player.combatLevel > myPlayer.combatLevel) c = '\u07D0'; if(myPlayer.team != 0 && player.team != 0) if(myPlayer.team == player.team) c = '\u07D0'; else c = '\0';

Could be done with a ternary chopping the code down to two lines i.e

if(myPlayer.team !=0 && player.team !=0) myPlayer.team == player.team ? '\u07D0' : '\0';

ThoughtCo

Definition and Example of the Java Ternary Operator

The ternary operator ?: earns its name because it's the only operator to take three operands. Find out more here.

Read full topic

item.title: Client.java Problem please read
item.dc:creator: @Dragon99999 Dragon99999
item.description:
@Dragon99999 wrote:

[quote=“Trade Me, post:2, topic:448302”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=551193.msg4039263#msg4039263 date=1341443575]
A for-loop had a bracket at the end of the code.

[/quote]

I’m sorry could you be more specific of what I need to change and where?[/quote]

I think he means on the first line of where the errors begin, that ‘for’ loop must have the correct bracing, which is why he put the ‘{’ at the end of the code.

Read full topic
